column3: I just tried this place on a whim. And let me tell you, it was an amazing decision! The owner is friendly and the coffee was superb! I had a Mexican Mocha and it was one of the best tasting coffee drinks I've ever had! It was delectable and placated my coffee addiction for a while!

I happened to stumble across this cafe and am so glad I did! Simple menu, delicious coffee, great record selection and genuine and friendly service. I only want good things for this place! Already looking forward to going back soon.
Cool little spot with records and good music! Really chill service and conversation too

Very small cute shop. They have coffee, some pastries, records, art etc. We got two lattes the Mexican Mocha and the horchata. Both were delicious and not overly sweet which I always appreciate. Also got two spinach and feta pastries which were amazing. Definitely worth a stop.

I Like this place but it’s frustrating that they don’t post an accurate schedule or keep to their posted hours.  I tried to go twice this week during hours when their website and their sign outside says they should be open, and they were closed with no explanation or notes on their website.  Consistency is important to me in a coffee place if I’m going to be a regular.  That said, food and drink quality are great if they’re actually open.  Edit to reply to owner:  having to close due to health reasons is understandable but next time please at least post a sign.  Your reply says back to normal hours “next week” but I have no idea what that means since you didn’t include a date.  Please be specific so people can plan their day!!  We need to know when you’re open and when you’re not!!
The coffee is top top level.  Raul and the staff are amazing, welcoming, and friendly.  The shop is so cool and has an excellent collection of books and music.  I'm not going anywhere else!
A sweet little local coffee place that also sells records. It’s a stone’s throw away from where I live. Hoping it becomes my regular morning coffee stop. Definitely coming back for more.
Very good coffee and pastries and Chris, the bartender, made me feel welcome everyday.  Besides, the second-hand records worth a browse.

This place is great. Always fast even if there's a small line. But even if there is, the owner is always talkative. And the coffee is great. I usually get a macchiato which has good balance but it can sometimes taste like the espresso is a little under or over extracted. Overall I love this place.  It is cash only!! So be careful of that one.
The best chocolate croissants I have ever had and I have tried many croissants in my life. The mocha is also superb.
Cool, chill spot for great coffee. Raul's Mexican Mocha and Eddie's Horchata Latte are our favorites.
Great coffee, real cups. In SF.

My favorite coffee shop in the city! Better cappuccino than Sightglass / etc. alongside a far better experience.  Amazing beans (I buy them for making my own espresso-based drinks) and the owner is extremely friendly. It’s a model local business.  It was recently renamed Cafe Suspiro, used to be called Vega, and is becoming a record shop + cafe. Highly recommend trying it out!

Among my favorite coffee shops in one of the greatest cities of coffee shops for two main reasons: the drinks are fantastic (try the New Orleans iced coffee for a real sweet treat!) and the service is genuine - it truly feels like that small-town warm & welcoming coffee shop! It also has a fun sports feel with lots of soccer apparel hanging along the walls
Lovely little coffeeshop in downtown SF. Very cozy with music and books. Right next to an art gallery too!

Our favorite local coffeeshop. We feel fortunate to have a place like this within a block! Raul's got a wonderful vision for coffee, books, music. We have been enjoying his coffee and company for years and look forward to the evolution of the shop.
perfectly curated little coffee, book and records shop.  a new jewel in the SOMA neighborhood.

Great coffee starts with great people and this place has both! From the drip to the espresso, every cup is made well. You can even order a box of coffee for work meetings or to bring to a party. Stop by and check this place out. You'll soon become a regular 😁 …
Awesome neighborhood spot for good coffee, records and books to browse and chill
Very chill, good coffee, food, AND records. Friendly guy working there.
Excellent coffee, pastries, and the owner is a delight to chat with. Very approachable and not snooty, unlike some other places in the area. Favorite coffee shop in the city!
Great coffee, super friendly staff.
Vega is great, the staff is all super friendly and they love our dog!  I promise he's not read, he just looks like that.
I bought a hot chocolate from here today 10/14/22 it was good 👍 and the person caucasian was very polite and they let me charge  my cellular device  for a few minutes inside  the small coffee shop  .
Had the best ham and cheese croissant of my life here and the horchata latte was so good the owner was so sweet too
The owner was friendly and shared us some wonderful ideas about incorporating their cafe with lots of art and music.  As a neighbor, I am looking forward for their business progress.
Excellent coffee, great staff. Easily my favorite coffee shop in the city.
Great spot! Stopped by with my dog, Moose, this week for the first time and enjoyed a tasty horchata latte. I’ll be back for many more!
Wonderful selection of records and amazing coffee and pastries. Owner was nice as hell too.

Best cappuccino in the city - never burnt, always perfect! I've had it here at least 20 times (worked nearby) and it's so much better than Sightglass' and Blue Bottle's. The staff is friendly, especially the slightly round guy whose name I forget. The owner refused to take shortcuts, which is amazing. Also good croissants (get them before they run out, before 8:30 usually).
Great coffee. Love the cold brew. And the owner is super friendly as well.

True neighborhood gem. Used to be cash only - and is the kind of spot where, if you didn't know, they'd still serve you and let you come back whenever to pay. Now accept cards, but still have the same good-will, chill vibes. And great drinks. And tasty dessert treats. With good people behind the counter and sweet tunes above it. :)
Great spot! Super friendly staff and excellent espresso pulls. So glad to have this in the neighborhood.

A humble little coffee joint nested on Folsom. It's got cool decor and nifty gear. Beans are roasted in house, providing flavorful coffee of a fair variety to fit the palates of daily commuters. Definitely recommend checking this place out!

This place has delicious coffee. There is barely any sitting room unless it's a nice day. On a nice day, you can sit in front on the "patio." I have only really had their lattes.  Everything in the cafe is scooter-themed, which is pretty interesting to look at while you're standing around waiting for your coffee.  The first few times I went, they weren't too busy and I enjoyed small talk with the barista. The last time I went was packed and busy and the woman behind the counter was making a lot of mistakes and pretty flustered, but it seemed like she might be new. The service was kind of slow which may have been on account of that or may be because they were super busy.  Anyways, the crucial thing is that their coffee is pretty delicious and a nice alternative to the super make-you-cringe hipsterdom of Sightglass down the street.

Best coffee shop in the San Francisco hands down. It's a small place that's decorated like a garage. You'll see little Italian scooters standing near the roof and posters of people racing Lambretta's. Excellent vibe and the staff is very friendly.

I met barista here who was incredibly sweet to me. She noticed I was having a rough day and having her just acknowledge that changed my attitude. Thank you! And thank you for the espresso! While you're here get the mochi muffin. Seriously.
Consistently very good can get busy at times
My favorite espresso in the city. Thoroughly enjoy the shop design + service with every visit. :-)
Amazing coffee, great services, yummy snacks. My favorite coffee place in SF!

VEGA is a small coffee boutique that most notably, sells Blue Bottle Coffee. It has an odd location in between auto shops, bars, and hipster cafes. I did not like the fact that I would feel like I was intruding if I stayed in the shop, although there is a small bar area you can stand at once you buy your coffee.. In addition the employee was civil but not friendly. The coffee was okay.  Personally I would prefer to go to other, more "traditional" style coffee shops where you can relax and have a nice conversation.
This is a great comfy hole-in-the wall coffee shop with incredible service and wonderful coffee. Highly recommend the iced horchata latte!

Love to drop by Vega and grab a great cup of coffee. There is always a new scooter being a wallflower that I can admire. It's comfy, quick and tasty! Word on the street is they will be opening another location across the street - sweet!
I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but the almond milk latte was great. They also have this vegan pineapple mochi thing - I had two. Awesome!

Super sweet little spot on Folsom! Love the old school ambiance and film playing in the background..it’s clear they keep regulars coming, and the reason is their friendliness :) The horchata latte is excellent👌🏼 Will be back! …
This place is awesome. Great coffee in a small but cute space (not big enough for working though). Plus the folks who work here are amazing. Very friendly, neighborhood vibe.
Love their coffee and whole beans are really good as well. We get the Clutch beans for our home. Highly recommended!
Small quiet coffee shop with a decent cup of espresso.  Seats will definitely become uncomfortable after a while.  A lot of local workers drop by for a cup of good coffee.  No iced mocha though.
My favorite coffee shop in a city full of excellent coffee shops. Friendly baristas churn out consistently delicious espresso beverages. You've tried the rest, now try the best.

Charming - totally SF, and QUALITY coffee. John Quintos does it again.  Vega is nothing like your average, everyday garage door coffee shoppe.  Seeing as how they're popping out all over SF as the Trend continues it's hard to stand out amongst the crowd. Vega has managed to do this with the small attachment of Goody Goodie providing quality pastries and baked goods to compliment your morning/afternoon/evening coffee.  Grab a coffee and go - on your scooter of course.
Coffee and Smiles/ good coffee starts with good people.We love to get our company meeting coffee here!
Raoul was great! We appreciated the friendly  conversation and sending off with coffee beans to try at home. Vega Cafe is a wonderful find in SOMA.
Loved the coffee and staff was super friendly. Really small shop but good coffee. Also it's not cash only, they take cards too.
better tasting coffee than sightglass, with the con of not being open on weekends

Tasty coffee (including some interesting variations you won't find elsewhere) and some good pastries. A great place to stop if you're just on your way somewhere, but there's no place to work for an extended amount of time or anything.
Vega is great! Raoul and co. are always friendly and helpful. Try their home-made oat bars.
Solid Coffee shop.   Always my first choice in this hood if they are open.    Fantastic pastries and free cookies sometimes too!
This place is totally cool.  No chai here, but you don't need it as they even have horchata lattes.  Check out the vespas and Quadrophenia photo.
Very refreshing Macau iced coffee !
I go here everyday for an Italian style coffee. Small, friendly, and always good.
Excellent cafe macchiato, cool place, smiling baristas--the type of spot that shows the still-beating heart and soul of the SF I love.
Great coffee, great pastries, low-key ambiance and very friendly staff. What else can you ask for?
The coffee is the best.  I enjoy the decor and shopping for used records while I wait.  Pretty handy thats its on the way to work for me.
Practically my daily stop for almost 4 years. Always friendly, great music and vibe, and let's not for get amazing coffee!
Best coffee and service around. Also have really good butter croissant for way less than at the other good coffee shops.
Vega is a really cute scooter themed coffee shop with excellent coffee, 4$ affogati, and great decor.
Chill moto-themed cafe, solid coffee. Google says it’s cash-only but credit cards are accepted! ☕️ 💳 …
Get the Macau. It’s an iced latte that is fantastic.
If Mr Riate is the most handsome barista in SF, I don't know who is.
Come and get your latte here! So good!
Great coffee, but they don't serve Blue Bottle anymore.
Great coffee, great experience.
Such good coffee! Also buy their beans.
One of the best coffee I've had in a while...
Best coffee around in a really cute and open setting
I don’t even like coffee that much, but this place is great.
Same great coffee as everywhere cento beans are sold.
Best vibe and coffee served out of a scooter garage. <3
Great place, great coffee. Cash Only
I like the Mocha coffee here
Visiting from Detroit.  Great coffee and conversation with barista Raoul.
This is USA not Europe 😁 sell real full size coffee …
Just a guy behind a counter serving great coffee.
Favorite coffee place in the city.
My usual go to place. Try the Hibiscus iced tea here.
Delicious coffee... Amazing service!
Good place to go just a little slow
Loved the mocha with oatmilk
Friendly staff, awesome coffee.
Great stop for a quick break with goid personality.
Best drip coffee in town!
Great cold brew. Chill crew
Great service and decent mochas.
Good Italian style espresso.
Best place for coffee and neighbors.
Greeted by a grumpy guy and escaped right away.
A bit overly busy for number of workers.
Great coffee. Cozy place.
Great little spot on Folsom.
Great staff, cash only.
Honestly, I don't remember the place.
Great Expresso, just like in Italy
Best iced latte around
Espresso is pretty good
Outstanding!
Good coffee!
Ital great!
Great coffee.
Very friendly
Nice roast
